cited_context_before: effectively giving everybody a tax cut, and is much quicker than the payroll tax cut," he said.STIMULUS CHECKS, STATE AID AND MORE: WHAT'S IN HOUSE DEMOCRATS' NEW CORONAVIRUS RELIEF BILLMeanwhile, key parts of the CARES Act are set to expire in the near future. The Paycheck Protection Program that provides small businesses with forgivable loans, is set to end in early August, and the enhanced unemployment insurance benefits will expire on July 31. A federal eviction ban already ended on July 25.
cited_quote: Mnuchin said that the new bill will provide additional unemployment benefits, but noted that it will be less than the payments issued under the CARES Act, because some workers were collecting more than they earned on the job. As a result, when businesses were reopening some employees did not have an incentive to return to work.Mnuchin said that upcoming unemployment benefits would be in the form of 70 percent wage replacement."

citing_quote: Mnuchin said that the new bill will provide additional unemployment benefits, but noted that it will be less than the payments issued under the CARES Act, because some workers were collecting more than they earned on the job. As a result, when businesses were reopening some employees did not have an incentive to return to work. Mnuchin said that upcoming unemployment benefits would be in the form of 70 percent wage replacement.
